page.title: 02THE SHIBDEN VALLEY
page.content: The ancient parish of{Northowram includes the whole of the upper {Shibden Valley}and{Stump Cross.}The picturesque{Shibden Valley}is a typical "V" shaped valley in its upper reaches, and follows the course of the Red Beck from{Queensbury}in the North to Brookfoot (Nr.{Brighouse)}in the South, where it joins the main{Calder {Valley.}Deposits of iron ore give the stream a "red" colour. The word Shibden comes from "Sheep Dale". During the last century there were at least four mills in the upper{Shibden {Valley,}but these have all disappeared except for a few "clues". The only industry in the valley today is a clay mine.
